pages.text: $(thing)Bowls$() are a versatile tool which can be used to make $(l:mechanics/salad)Salads$(), to make $(l:mechanics/pot)Soups$(), to $(l:mechanics/decay#salting)Salt$() meat, or to apply $(thing)Powder$() to $(l:mechanics/glassworking_applications#coloring)Glass$() in order to change the resulting glass's color.$(br2)Bowls can be made both from $(thing)Ceramic$(), by knapping a bowl out of clay, and then firing them.
Multiple unfired bowls can be made from one knapping.

pages.title: Wooden Bowls
pages.text: Bowls can also be made out of wood via crafting them together with $(thing)Glue$()$(br2)$(thing)Glue$() can be made by soaking $(thing)Bone Meal$() in a barrel of $(l:mechanics/barrels#limewater)Limewater$().

Bowls can also be placed on the ground like blocks. When placed, they can be filled with any type of $(thing)Powder$() - the results of grinding ores, minerals, or gems in the $(l:mechanics/quern)Quern$().

pages.title: Powders
pages.text: The Powder Bowl can hold up to 16 of a given powder. To insert items, $(item)$(k:key.use)$() while holding the powder. To extract items, $(item)$(k:key.use)$() with an empty hand.$(br2)$(item)$(k:key.sneak)$() allows extracting the entire contents of the bowl.
If there is salt in the bowl, clicking with unsalted raw meat will salt the meat. This is the same as crafting the meat with the salt in your inventory.
